physical_appearance: This is a black-and-white photograph. It is rectangular in shape and landscape in orientation. It features a group of three men and two women, seated around a small table. Four of them are turned towards the camera, while the woman on the right most is facing the group. They are photographed in a room with windows along the left. There are no inscriptions on the photograph. There are no tears or folds seen.
sgcool_label_text: This is a personal photograph album that belonged to a Corporal A. Silver who spent 16 months in Singapore between 1951 and 1952. Silver was presumably a Jewish lady who was stationed in Singapore to serve at the Royal Air Force (RAF) Hospital at Changi. The album contains photographs that document her working and personal life, including friends she made within the Jewish community in Singapore.
title_text: "Personal photograph album titled ""Sixteen Months in Singapore""" Sixteen Months in Singapore: Photograph of Corporal A. Silver and others seated around a table
subject_terms_1: women (female humans) men (male humans) groups of people snapshots
